result.execSummary:
The defendant John S Arnold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500 fine plus costs.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John S Arnold

records.addlTxt: Defendant John S Arnold in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for John S Arnold.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1.  Defendant does not make a statement.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea, and adjudges the defendant guilty.  Court gives warnings as to deportation if not a citizen of the US.  Court sentences defendant to a $500 fine plus costs, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant John S Arnold in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for John S Arnold.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Joint agreement, set for plea and sentencing. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM337, 22CT266 & 22CT228

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant John S Arnold in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Samuel Berg. Attorney Keith Venema appears with the Defendant Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CM337 and adjourned initial appearances on 22CT260 and 22CT226. Atty. will need to be appointed on new file. Clerk swears the defendant who responds to questions regarding finances. Based upon record, Atty. Venema is appointed on the new file as well. Record by Atty. Venema who waives reading of complaint on new file and enters not guilty plea on all files and asks for status. Discussion as to bond. Court has bond in CT Files cover new file and sets all matters out about 45 days.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
